title: Something that really buggs me about this new champ select
body: Whenever I have a champion selected, but not locked in, I am kicked from the que when the time runs out. This is really annoying compared to the old one because even if im out of time to pick a different champion atleast im not getting kicked from the game.

replies.body: Riot needs to re-implement hover lock-ins. It's just easier for someone who needs to back out for a bit to do something and they can't just straight up click "lock in." Or what they could do is at least keep it the same for Ranked, and just removed it from Normal Draft. Since any smart person in Ranked would make sure they don't need to do anything right before the game starts.

Then lock in. The point of that requirement is, ideally, to get everyone to make their choices quickly and move on once they've ben made.

Why is this even an issue when you're given ample time to pick?

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dT2uQb6K,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-15T13:48:43.803+0000)
>
> Then lock in. The point of that requirement is, ideally, to get everyone to make their choices quickly and move on once they've ben made.
> 
> Why is this even an issue when you're given ample time to pick?

It wasnt an issue because we used to be able to pick our champion then AFK for a short while (going to the bathroom or something) or we even forget to do so and we still get kicked from the game. Its a pointless addition .

It's not pointless at all; there's a clear, obvious intent, which the second sentence of my post addressed.  With a forced lock-in, people have to be at the ready, paying attention, and hopefully doing things fast. This makes it harder for one bloke to waste 9 other blokes' time.

Am I explaining this adequately? This new feature should only a problem to those who already a blight on champion select by not locking in their choices and forcing others to wait on them.

Or are you going to assert that it's ok for someone to hold things up because they can't or won't adequately partition their time and pay attention?

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dT2uQb6K,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-15T16:08:16.613+0000)

> Or are you going to assert that it's ok for someone to hold things up because they can't or won't adequately partition their time and pay attention?

I see your point, but getting kicked for not locking in is pointless and was never a thing until now. You fail to see how it inconveniences many people more then it does to people having to wait an extra 10-40 seconds.
No, I see how it inconveniences all these other people. The issue is that they are an inconvenience to everyone else, and the kick is to stop them from doing that.

Think of it this way: Someone forgets to lock in, god forbid that guys last pick 2-5 minutes of time was just wasted collectively.
You and I just aren't going to agree over this. I think that the kick is well deserved and you don't.
So am not the only one having that happen to me  ^^^
